attributes.action: Allow Remote Voting for MPs unable to attend Parliament
attributes.additional_details:
The government must immediately introduce remote voting for MPs who are shielding or otherwise unable to attend Parliament.

This will protect UK citizens democratic right to be represented in Parliament and hold the government to account.

The current proposals effectively removes democracy from millions of citizens based on a lottery of whether their MP is able to attend Parliament or not.
attributes.background:
The Government's removal of remote voting during the coronavirus pandemic has left many MPs unable to vote in parliamentary debates stripping them of a core principle of our democracy.

This must be reversed immediately to restore democratic representation to the affected MPs constituents.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

The virtual parliament must remain in place whilst social distancing exists: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321924

Keep virtual parliament options for MPs who are shielding or isolating: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323109

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
